feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 4:31PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...STRONG WINDS AND HIGH SURF EXPECTED FROM KIPNUK TO THE MOUTH OF THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER THURSDAY... A cold front will track across the eastern Bering late Wednesday into Thursday. Southerly wind gusts of 40 to 50 mph are expected along the Kuskokwim Delta coast and across Kuskokwim Bay. High surf of 1 to 3 feet above the normal highest tide line is possible

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 2:37PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Glacier Dammed lake release causing debris to flow into Controller Bay... Satellite observations indicate that the Berg glacier dammed lake, located 65 miles east of Cordova, has likely released downstream into the Gandil River, Bering River and Bering Lake. High water from this glacier dammed lake release usually lasts for several days with large areas

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued August 23 at 12:55PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AKDT SATURDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by elevated river levels will continue into the weekend. * WHERE...The mainstem Kenai River is the most likely place to experience minor flooding. * WHEN...Until 500 PM AKDT Saturday.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 12:05PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HEAVY RAIN TUESDAY NIGHT AND WEDNESDAY... A couple of waves moving N along a stalled front over the central gulf will bring periods of moderate to heavy rain to the NE gulf coast. As of noon Tuesday 0.88 inches of rain has fallen from the first wave. A lull in rainfall rates between waves will occur Tuesday afternoon and evening. The second wave then moves into the
entry.cap:areaDesc: Cape Fairweather to Cape Suckling Coastal Area

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued August 23 at 11:30AM AKDT until August 23 at 7:00PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...South winds gusting to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...From Black Rapids north. * WHEN...Until 7 PM AKDT this evening. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 11:29AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...RISING WATER LEVELS ON SMALL STREAMS AND CREEKS DRAINING THE BROOKS RANGE... A series of fronts will impact the region, bringing copious amounts of widespread rain that will cause water levels to rise on small streams and creeks draining the south slopes of the Western Brooks Range.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 11:29AM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ..ELEVATED SURF LIKELY ON THURSDAY AND FRIDAY... Strong south winds to 25 to 40 mph will move into the West Coast and bring elevated surf to parts of Norton Sound and the Yukon Delta on Thursday, persisting into Friday before they diminish. Wave action will combine with storm surge and be the greatest along south facing coastlines, with anticipated storm surge
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Norton Sound and Nulato Hills; Southern Seward Peninsula Coast; Yukon Delta

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 8:28PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Limestone County through 930 PM CDT... At 827 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Athens. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Heavy downpours reducing visibility, and producing rainfall of 1 to 2 inches in less than one hour.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 7:39PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Marshall, southwestern Jackson and southeastern Madison Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 738 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Grant, or 13 miles north of Guntersville, and was nearly stationary.

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued August 23 at 6:29PM MST until August 23 at 7:15PM MST by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR EAST CENTRAL PIMA COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 630 PM MST... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and no longer poses an immediate threat to life or property. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However gusty winds are still possible with this thunderstorm.
